OPPORTUNITY.title: Secret Passage
OPPORTUNITY.description: You notice unusual wear patterns on the floor leading to a wall section.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Perception to find hidden door
OPPORTUNITY.success: You discover a secret passage that bypasses the next 3 rooms. Saves 30 minutes of exploration.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: You don't find anything unusual. Continue the normal way.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If found, skip next 3 dice jar rolls. Mark on map.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Eavesdropping Opportunity
OPPORTUNITY.description: You hear voices nearby - creatures discussing their patrol route.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Stealth to get close, DC 18 Society to understand their language
OPPORTUNITY.success: You learn the patrol schedule: they pass through here every 2 hours. You know when it's safe.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: You make noise and alert them, or can't understand their language.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If successful, next 2 encounters can be avoided with timing. Add 1 die to jar for time spent.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Abandoned Supplies
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find a cache of supplies left by previous explorers - bandages, healing herbs, and rations.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Medicine to use supplies effectively
OPPORTUNITY.success: Each party member can heal 2d8 HP. Takes 10 minutes.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Supplies are too old or damaged. Heal only 1d8 HP.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Add 1 die to jar for time spent. Good reward for exploration.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Friendly Ghost
OPPORTUNITY.description: A translucent figure appears - a former servant who died here centuries ago. They seem willing to talk.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Diplomacy to gain trust, DC 18 Religion to understand their nature
OPPORTUNITY.success: The ghost warns you about a trap ahead and tells you how to disarm it safely.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The ghost fades away, frightened or offended.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If successful, next trap is automatically disarmed or avoided.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Environmental Advantage
OPPORTUNITY.description: You spot potential tactical advantages here - unstable structures, flammable materials, or elevated positions.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Crafting to rig a trap, DC 18 Athletics to position it correctly
OPPORTUNITY.success: You create a trap. Next enemy encounter triggers it for 3d6 damage to all enemies.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Trap is poorly made and won't trigger reliably.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Add 1 die to jar. Mark trap on map. Triggers on next combat encounter. Adapt trap type to actual environment.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Magical Residue
OPPORTUNITY.description: The air shimmers with recent magical energy. Someone cast powerful magic here recently.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Arcana to identify the spell and its purpose
OPPORTUNITY.success: You identify a teleportation spell. Someone left in a hurry. You know danger is ahead.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The magical signature is too complex to decipher.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If successful, players know next encounter is dangerous. Can prepare accordingly.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Fresh Tracks
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find fresh tracks in the dust - multiple creatures passed through here recently.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Survival to identify creatures and direction
OPPORTUNITY.success: You identify the creatures and know they went ahead. You can avoid or ambush them.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: Tracks are too muddled to read clearly.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If successful, next encounter can be avoided or players get surprise round.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Architectural Weakness
OPPORTUNITY.description: You notice structural weakness here - old damage from past battles or natural decay.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Crafting to identify weak points, DC 16 Athletics to trigger collapse safely
OPPORTUNITY.success: You can collapse part of this area behind you, blocking pursuit. Or save for later.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The structure is more stable than it looks.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If used, blocks passage. Pursuing enemies must find another route (buys time). Adapt to actual structure.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Ancient Inscription
OPPORTUNITY.description: Carved into the wall here is text in an ancient language, partially worn away.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 19 Society to translate, DC 17 Religion if it's religious text
OPPORTUNITY.success: The inscription provides useful information about this area or warnings about dangers.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The text is too damaged to read fully.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Provides map knowledge or warnings. Adapt content to actual dungeon layout.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Distracted Guards
OPPORTUNITY.description: Nearby, guards are arguing loudly about something. They're completely focused on each other.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Stealth to avoid notice, or DC 17 Deception to join their argument and distract them further
OPPORTUNITY.success: You slip past unnoticed or convince them to leave to 'check something'.
OPPORTUNITY.time_cost: 1 action to sneak, 5 minutes to deceive
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Avoids combat encounter. If deception used, guards leave for 30 minutes.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Healing Spring
OPPORTUNITY.description: A small spring bubbles from the wall. The water glows faintly and smells sweet.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Nature to identify if safe, DC 19 Arcana to detect magic
OPPORTUNITY.success: It's a natural healing spring! Each person who drinks heals 3d8 HP.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: You're not sure if it's safe. Drinking requires DC 15 Fortitude save or become sickened 1.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Major healing opportunity. Add 1 die to jar for time spent.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Weapon Cache
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find a hidden armory - racks of weapons covered in dust but still functional.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Perception to find, DC 17 Crafting to assess quality
OPPORTUNITY.success: You find 1d4 +1 weapons appropriate for your party. Take what you need.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The weapons are too corroded or damaged to be useful.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Significant treasure. Add 1 die to jar. Weapons are +1 striking if party level 4+.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Sleeping Enemy
OPPORTUNITY.description: A powerful enemy is sleeping nearby, snoring loudly. They're alone and vulnerable.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Stealth to avoid waking them OR automatic surprise round if you attack
OPPORTUNITY.success: You pass unnoticed or get a free surprise round in combat.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: They wake up! Roll initiative normally.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: If attacked with surprise, enemy is flat-footed and prone. Major advantage.
OPPORTUNITY.reward: Avoid encounter or major combat advantage

OPPORTUNITY.title: Treasure Map
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find a crude map scratched into the wall showing an 'X' marks the spot.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 17 Survival to navigate to the location, DC 18 Society to interpret symbols
OPPORTUNITY.success: You find the hidden treasure: 100gp per party member and 1 random magic item.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The map is too vague or the treasure has already been looted.
OPPORTUNITY.time_cost: 20 minutes to search (add 2 dice to jar)
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Significant treasure reward. Worth the time investment.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Friendly Creature
OPPORTUNITY.description: A small creature approaches cautiously. It seems intelligent and friendly.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Nature to understand its behavior, DC 16 Diplomacy to befriend it
OPPORTUNITY.success: It becomes your companion for this floor. Grants +2 to Perception checks and warns of danger.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Companion lasts until you leave this floor. Provides warning before ambushes.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Alchemical Lab
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find an abandoned alchemist's workspace with intact equipment and ingredients.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 18 Crafting to brew potions, DC 17 Nature to identify ingredients
OPPORTUNITY.success: You can craft 1d4 healing potions (moderate) or other alchemical items.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The ingredients are too degraded or you lack the skill.
OPPORTUNITY.time_cost: 30 minutes to brew (add 3 dice to jar)
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Major time investment but significant reward. Potions are moderate healing (2d8+10).

OPPORTUNITY.title: Ventilation Shaft
OPPORTUNITY.description: You spot a ventilation shaft that connects to other areas. It's narrow but passable.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 16 Athletics to climb through, DC 17 Survival to navigate correctly
OPPORTUNITY.success: You emerge 2 floors ahead! Massive shortcut discovered.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: You get lost in the shafts and emerge where you started (waste 20 minutes).
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Success skips entire floor! Remove 5 dice from jar. Mark on map.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Ritual Circle
OPPORTUNITY.description: An intact ritual circle glows faintly. It's still charged with magic.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to activate safely, DC 20 Religion if divine magic
OPPORTUNITY.success: The circle grants everyone a +1 status bonus to all saves for 1 hour.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: The circle discharges harmlessly. Magic is wasted.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Significant buff. Add 1 die to jar. Bonus lasts 1 hour of game time.

OPPORTUNITY.title: Spy Hole
OPPORTUNITY.description: You find a hidden spy hole that lets you observe a nearby area. You can see what's there.
OPPORTUNITY.challenge: DC 15 Perception to find, DC 16 Stealth to observe without being noticed
OPPORTUNITY.success: You see what's nearby and can plan accordingly. Gain +2 to initiative if you engage.
OPPORTUNITY.failure: You don't find it or make noise while looking.
OPPORTUNITY.gm_notes: Allows players to prepare for next encounter. +2 initiative is significant.

COMPLICATION.title: Locked Door
COMPLICATION.description: The door you need to pass through is locked. The mechanism is complex but functional.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Thievery to pick lock OR DC 22 Athletics to force open
COMPLICATION.success: Door opens. Quietly if picked, loudly if forced.
COMPLICATION.failure: Lock jams (Thievery) or door holds (Athletics). Must find key or try different approach.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If forced open, noise may attract attention.

COMPLICATION.title: Unstable Structure
COMPLICATION.description: The floor/ceiling here is cracked and unstable. You hear ominous creaking as you move.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Acrobatics to move carefully OR DC 19 Crafting to brace it
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone moves safely. Crafting solution is permanent.
COMPLICATION.failure: Structure fails. Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or takes 2d6 damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Crafting takes time but helps on return trip.

COMPLICATION.title: Magical Ward
COMPLICATION.description: A glowing sigil appears on the wall/door here. Touching it would trigger an alarm.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to dispel OR DC 20 Thievery to disable the physical trigger
COMPLICATION.success: Ward is disabled. You can proceed safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Ward triggers! Alarm sounds throughout this floor.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If failed, remaining encounters on this floor are alerted.

COMPLICATION.title: Language Barrier
COMPLICATION.description: A wounded creature tries to communicate. They seem to have important information.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Society to identify language OR DC 16 Diplomacy with gestures
COMPLICATION.success: They warn you about danger ahead and tell you the safe route.
COMPLICATION.failure: You can't communicate. They flee in fear or frustration.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If successful, next encounter can be avoided entirely.

COMPLICATION.title: Tracking Challenge
COMPLICATION.description: Fresh tracks lead away. Someone or something passed through recently.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Survival to track quickly and quietly
COMPLICATION.success: You find them before they can alert others. Surprise round.
COMPLICATION.failure: You lose the trail, or they hear you coming.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Success = surprise round for party. Failure = surprise round for enemy.

COMPLICATION.title: Poisoned Air
COMPLICATION.description: Toxic mist begins seeping into this area from cracks. The smell is acrid and burning.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Nature to identify poison OR DC 19 Medicine to treat symptoms
COMPLICATION.success: You neutralize the poison or treat everyone. Can continue safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Everyone makes DC 17 Fortitude save or become sickened 1 for 1 hour.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Sickened 1 = -1 to all checks. Significantly weakens party.

COMPLICATION.title: Collapsing Structure
COMPLICATION.description: Cracks spread rapidly. Debris falls. It's going to collapse!
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Athletics to brace while others escape OR DC 18 Acrobatics to dodge debris
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone escapes safely. If braced, passage remains open.
COMPLICATION.failure: Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If passage collapses, must find alternate route (adds 30 minutes).

COMPLICATION.title: Puzzle Lock
COMPLICATION.description: The way forward is blocked by a complex mechanical puzzle - gears, levers, and symbols.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Crafting to solve mechanically OR DC 20 Arcana if magical
COMPLICATION.success: Lock opens. You can proceed.
COMPLICATION.failure: Lock remains sealed. Must find another way or the key.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Alternative: find key elsewhere in dungeon.

COMPLICATION.title: Intimidating Presence
COMPLICATION.description: A powerful creature enters this area. They're wary but not immediately hostile.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Diplomacy to negotiate OR DC 19 Intimidation to make them back down
COMPLICATION.success: They leave you alone. May even provide information if Diplomacy used.
COMPLICATION.failure: They attack. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Diplomacy may turn them into ally. Intimidation makes them hostile later.

COMPLICATION.title: Performance Required
COMPLICATION.description: Guards approach and challenge you. They're bored and want you to prove you're 'worthy' to be here.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Performance to entertain OR DC 18 Deception to pretend you're expected
COMPLICATION.success: They let you continue. May even give you information.
COMPLICATION.failure: They're offended or suspicious. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Creative solution to avoid combat.

COMPLICATION.title: Slippery Surface
COMPLICATION.description: The floor here suddenly becomes covered in slime, oil, or ice. Very treacherous.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Acrobatics to move safely OR DC 18 Athletics to power through
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone moves without incident.
COMPLICATION.failure: Fall prone and slide 10 feet. Take 1d6 damage if you hit a wall.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Falling prone in combat is dangerous. Consider cleaning the area.

COMPLICATION.title: Narrow Passage
COMPLICATION.description: The way forward narrows to a tight squeeze. Medium creatures must crawl.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 15 Athletics to squeeze through OR DC 17 Survival to find alternate route
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone gets through safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Someone gets stuck. Takes 10 minutes to free them (add 1 die to jar).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Small creatures pass easily. Large creatures can't fit at all.

COMPLICATION.title: Darkness
COMPLICATION.description: All light sources suddenly extinguish. Magical darkness fills the area.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Arcana to dispel OR DC 16 Survival to navigate by touch/sound
COMPLICATION.success: You overcome the darkness and continue.
COMPLICATION.failure: You stumble around. Takes 10 minutes to find your way (add 1 die to jar).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Creatures with darkvision are unaffected.

COMPLICATION.title: Illusory Wall
COMPLICATION.description: The wall here shimmers slightly. It might be an illusion hiding something.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Perception to notice OR DC 20 Arcana to analyze the illusion
COMPLICATION.success: You find a hidden passage or shortcut!
COMPLICATION.failure: You don't notice anything unusual.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Success might reveal shortcut, hidden treasure, or secret door.

COMPLICATION.title: Swarm Incoming
COMPLICATION.description: A swarm of rats, insects, or bats suddenly rushes through this area. Not dangerous but disruptive.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 16 Nature to calm them OR DC 17 Intimidation to scare them off
COMPLICATION.success: Swarm disperses or avoids you.
COMPLICATION.failure: Swarm attacks! Everyone takes 1d4 damage and must make DC 15 Will save or become frightened 1.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Frightened 1 = -1 to all checks for 1 round.

COMPLICATION.title: Suspicious Stain
COMPLICATION.description: A large dark stain covers the floor. Could be blood, acid, or something worse.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Crafting to identify substance OR DC 18 Medicine if it's biological
COMPLICATION.success: You identify it and know how to safely cross.
COMPLICATION.failure: You step in it. Make DC 16 Fortitude save or take 2d6 acid damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Could be trap residue, monster remains, or environmental hazard.

COMPLICATION.title: Echoing Chamber
COMPLICATION.description: This chamber amplifies all sounds. Even whispers echo loudly.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Stealth to move silently OR DC 16 Performance to use acoustics to confuse enemies
COMPLICATION.success: You cross without alerting anyone, or you create a diversion.
COMPLICATION.failure: Your noise echoes throughout the floor. All encounters are now alerted.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Performance success can send enemies to wrong location.

COMPLICATION.title: Rickety Bridge
COMPLICATION.description: A rope bridge spans a chasm. It looks old and frayed.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Acrobatics to cross carefully OR DC 19 Crafting to reinforce it
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone crosses safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Bridge breaks! Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or falls 20 feet (4d6 damage).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Crafting makes it safe for return trip.

COMPLICATION.title: Magical Feedback
COMPLICATION.description: Residual magic in the area interferes with spellcasting.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to stabilize the magic OR DC 17 Religion if divine magic
COMPLICATION.success: Magic stabilizes. Spellcasters can cast normally.
COMPLICATION.failure: Magic remains unstable. All spells cast here require DC 15 flat check or fizzle.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Affects both party and enemy spellcasters.

COMPLICATION.title: Ancient Inscription
COMPLICATION.description: Runes cover the walls. They might contain important information or warnings.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Society to translate OR DC 19 Arcana if magical runes
COMPLICATION.success: You learn about a trap ahead, enemy weakness, or hidden treasure location.
COMPLICATION.failure: You can't decipher it. Miss important information.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Success gives tactical advantage in next encounter.

COMPLICATION.title: Cursed Object
COMPLICATION.description: A beautiful item sits on a pedestal, glowing invitingly. It radiates magic.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Religion to detect curse, DC 20 Arcana to safely dispel
COMPLICATION.success: You identify and remove the curse. The item is safe to take (minor magic item).
COMPLICATION.failure: You touch it. Make DC 17 Will save or become cursed (GM's choice of effect).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Curse could be: -1 to saves, can't heal naturally, nightmares, etc.

COMPLICATION.title: Rising Water
COMPLICATION.description: Water begins flooding into this area from cracks in the walls. It's rising fast - already ankle-deep.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Athletics to wade through quickly, DC 18 Survival to find the source and plug it
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone moves through safely, or the flooding stops.
COMPLICATION.failure: Water rises to waist-deep. Make DC 16 Reflex save or lose footing (1d6 damage, lose 1 action).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Wet equipment may be damaged. Scrolls and books need protection. Water continues rising if not stopped.

COMPLICATION.title: Territorial Beast
COMPLICATION.description: A large beast emerges, having made this area its den. It's not evil, just protective.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 17 Nature to calm it, DC 18 Intimidation to scare it off
COMPLICATION.success: Beast allows you to stay or leaves the area.
COMPLICATION.failure: Beast attacks. Roll initiative.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If calmed with Nature, beast may help in next combat. If intimidated, it flees.

COMPLICATION.title: Magical Darkness
COMPLICATION.description: Unnatural darkness fills the area. Even darkvision doesn't work here.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to dispel, DC 17 Religion if unholy darkness
COMPLICATION.success: Darkness lifts. You can see normally.
COMPLICATION.failure: Darkness remains. Must navigate blind (all creatures are concealed).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If not dispelled, all attacks have 20% miss chance. Very dangerous.

COMPLICATION.title: Pressure Plate
COMPLICATION.description: You spot a suspicious tile in the floor. It's slightly raised.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Perception to notice, DC 19 Thievery to disarm
COMPLICATION.success: Trap is disarmed. You can pass safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Trap triggers! Darts shoot from walls. Everyone makes DC 18 Reflex save or takes 3d6 damage.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: If triggered, noise alerts nearby enemies.

COMPLICATION.title: Unstable Magic
COMPLICATION.description: Wild magic surges through this area. Spells behave unpredictably.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 19 Arcana to stabilize, DC 18 Religion if divine magic
COMPLICATION.success: Magic stabilizes. Spells work normally.
COMPLICATION.failure: Wild magic persists. All spells cast here roll on wild magic table.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Wild magic can help or hurt. 50/50 chance of beneficial/harmful effect.

COMPLICATION.title: Negotiation Opportunity
COMPLICATION.description: Intelligent creatures arrive and are willing to talk. They want something.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Diplomacy to negotiate, DC 17 Society to understand their culture
COMPLICATION.success: You make a deal. They leave you alone or provide information.
COMPLICATION.failure: Negotiations break down. They attack or demand too much.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: They might want: gold, magic item, promise of help, or just respect.

COMPLICATION.title: Crumbling Ledge
COMPLICATION.description: The ground here begins crumbling beneath your feet. One wrong step...
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Acrobatics to move carefully, DC 19 Athletics to jump to safety
COMPLICATION.success: Everyone moves to safety.
COMPLICATION.failure: Someone falls! Make DC 18 Reflex save to catch edge or fall (damage based on actual drop).
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Falling makes noise. May alert enemies. Adapt fall distance to actual dungeon.

COMPLICATION.title: Magical Lock
COMPLICATION.description: The way forward is sealed by a glowing magical barrier - no keyhole, only magic.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 20 Arcana to dispel, DC 18 Thievery to find hidden mechanism
COMPLICATION.success: Barrier drops. You can proceed.
COMPLICATION.failure: Barrier remains. Must find another way.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Alternative: find command word elsewhere in dungeon.

COMPLICATION.title: Haunted Area
COMPLICATION.description: The temperature drops. You see your breath. Ghostly whispers fill the air.
COMPLICATION.challenge: DC 18 Religion to bless area, DC 17 Occultism to understand spirits
COMPLICATION.success: Spirits calm or leave. You can pass safely.
COMPLICATION.failure: Spirits attack! Everyone makes DC 17 Will save or become frightened 2.
COMPLICATION.gm_notes: Frightened 2 = -2 to all checks for 2 rounds. Very debilitating.

DILEMMA.title: Approach: Loud vs Quiet
DILEMMA.description: You can hear activity ahead. You could move quickly and directly (fast but noisy) or take your time being stealthy (slow but hidden).
DILEMMA.choice_a: Move quickly: 10 minutes, but next encounter is alerted to your presence
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move stealthily: 30 minutes (add 2 dice to jar), but next encounter doesn't know you're coming
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Track choice. Quick approach = enemies get surprise round. Stealthy approach = party gets surprise round.

DILEMMA.title: Imprisoned Creature
DILEMMA.description: A creature is locked in a cage, begging for freedom. They claim they were captured unjustly and will help you.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Free them now: Takes 10 minutes (add 1 die), makes noise, but gain potential ally
DILEMMA.choice_b: Come back later: Mark location, but they might be dead or moved when you return
DILEMMA.choice_c: Leave them: No time cost, no risk, but no ally and they might alert enemies
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If freed: 50% chance they help in next combat, 50% they flee. If left: they alert enemies.

DILEMMA.title: Fight Now or Avoid
DILEMMA.description: You spot a patrol ahead. They haven't seen you yet. You're at full strength.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Fight now: Combat while you're fresh and they're unprepared (surprise round)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Sneak past: DC 17 Stealth. Success = avoid combat. Failure = they join next encounter as reinforcements
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If avoided and Stealth fails, add these enemies to next combat encounter (harder fight).
DILEMMA.consequence: Fight now vs potentially harder fight later

DILEMMA.title: Rest Here or Push On
DILEMMA.description: You find a defensible room. You're wounded and low on resources. But resting here is risky.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Rest here: 10 minutes to Treat Wounds (add 1 die to jar). DC 15 Perception to avoid ambush during rest.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Push on: No healing, but no risk of ambush. Continue while wounded.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If rest and fail Perception: ambush during rest (party is flat-footed). If push on: next combat is harder.

DILEMMA.title: Loot Now or Later
DILEMMA.description: You find a treasure room in {space}, but it will take time to search thoroughly. You hear movement nearby.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Loot now: 10 minutes (add 1 die to jar). Roll on treasure table. But enemies might arrive.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Mark for later: No time cost now, but treasure might be gone when you return (50% chance).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If loot now: roll dice jar immediately after. If mark for later: 50% chance treasure is gone.

DILEMMA.title: Chase Fleeing Enemy
DILEMMA.description: An enemy breaks away {combat_context} and flees toward their allies to raise the alarm.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Chase them: Pursue and fight now (1 enemy, but you're split from party)
DILEMMA.choice_b: Let them go: They alert others. Next encounter has +2 enemies and they're prepared.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If chase: solo combat for fastest PC. If let go: next encounter is significantly harder.
DILEMMA.consequence: Risk one PC vs harder group fight

DILEMMA.title: Ritual in Progress
DILEMMA.description: Through a doorway, you see creatures performing a ritual. It's almost complete.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Interrupt now: Surprise round, but you don't know what the ritual does
DILEMMA.choice_b: Watch and learn: DC 19 Arcana to understand ritual. Takes 5 minutes. They complete it but you know what to expect.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If watch: ritual completes (enemy gets buff/summon). But party knows and can counter. If interrupt: surprise but unknown effect.

DILEMMA.title: Wounded Ally
DILEMMA.description: One party member is bleeding badly (persistent bleed damage). You can stop to treat them or push forward.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Treat Wounds now: 10 minutes (add 1 die to jar). Heal 2d8 HP and stop bleeding.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Push on: Ally takes 1d6 damage each turn until treated. But no time cost.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If push on: track bleed damage. Ally might go down before next rest. Add 1 die to jar when finally treated.

DILEMMA.title: Alarm Triggered
DILEMMA.description: You accidentally triggered a magical alarm. A bell is ringing loudly. You have seconds to act.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Disable alarm: DC 20 Thievery or Arcana. Takes 3 actions. If failed, alarm continues.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Flee immediately: Run to next room and barricade. Enemies will search but might not find you (DC 17 Stealth).
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If alarm continues: all encounters on this floor are alerted and prepared. If flee successfully: only nearby enemies respond.

DILEMMA.title: Treasure vs Time
DILEMMA.description: You find a locked chest. It looks valuable but the lock is complex. You hear footsteps approaching.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Pick lock now: DC 19 Thievery, takes 10 minutes (add 1 die). Enemies will arrive during attempt.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Ignore it: No time cost, but lose potential treasure and it might be gone later.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Take whole chest: Athletics DC 18 to carry (Bulk 4). Slows movement but can open later.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If pick now: roll dice jar during attempt. If take chest: -5 ft speed until dropped. If ignore: treasure is gone.

DILEMMA.title: Sacrifice for Information
DILEMMA.description: A dying enemy offers information about the floor layout and traps in exchange for healing.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Heal them: Use spell slot or potion. Get detailed map and trap locations.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Intimidate: DC 18 Intimidation. They talk but info might be incomplete or false.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Let them die: No cost, but lose valuable intelligence.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If healed: accurate info. If intimidated: 50% chance of false info. If ignored: miss shortcuts.

DILEMMA.title: Scout Ahead or Stay Together
DILEMMA.description: The way forward looks dangerous. You could send a scout to check for threats, or move as a group.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Send scout ahead: One PC scouts alone (DC 18 Perception for traps/enemies). Faster but risky if ambushed.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Move as group: 20 minutes longer (add 2 dice to jar). Everyone stays together and safe.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Rush through: Faster but everyone risks triggering traps. Multiple DC 18 Reflex saves.
DILEMMA.time_cost: 10 min vs 30 min vs 10 min with risk
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Splitting party is risky but efficient. Cautious approach is slow. Rushing is dangerous.
DILEMMA.consequence: Speed vs safety vs party cohesion

DILEMMA.title: Magical Artifact Choice
DILEMMA.description: You find three magical items on pedestals. You can only take one before the others vanish.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Weapon: +1 striking weapon of your choice. Immediate combat power.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Armor: +1 resilient armor. Better defense for the dungeon.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Utility: Bag of holding or similar. Carry more loot and supplies.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Each choice benefits different playstyles. No wrong answer but creates discussion.

DILEMMA.title: Poison the Well
DILEMMA.description: You find the enemy's water supply. You have poison that could sicken them all.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Poison it: All enemies on this floor become sickened 1 for 24 hours. Easier fights but morally questionable.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Don't poison: Keep moral high ground but fights are normal difficulty.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Sickened 1 = -1 to all checks. Significant advantage. But is it right?

DILEMMA.title: Rescue or Mission
DILEMMA.description: You hear prisoners crying for help nearby. But your mission is time-sensitive.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Rescue now: 20 minutes (add 2 dice). Prisoners become allies and provide info.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Mission first: Continue to objective. Prisoners might be dead when you return.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: If rescued: gain 1d4 NPC allies for this floor. If ignored: moral weight and potential loss.

DILEMMA.title: Destroy or Claim
DILEMMA.description: You find an evil artifact. It's powerful but corrupting.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Destroy it: DC 20 Religion or Arcana. Takes 10 minutes. Enemies lose power source.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Claim it: Gain powerful item but risk corruption. DC 17 Will save each day or become evil.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Leave it: No risk, no reward. Enemies keep their power.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Corruption is real. Will saves get harder each day. But power is tempting.

DILEMMA.title: Barricade or Ambush
DILEMMA.description: You know enemies are coming. You have time to prepare in {space}.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Barricade: 10 minutes to build defenses. Enemies can't reach you easily (+2 AC, cover).
DILEMMA.choice_b: Ambush: 10 minutes to set trap. Enemies take 3d6 damage when they arrive.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Flee: Leave now. Avoid fight but enemies will pursue later.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Both preparation options are good. Fleeing means harder fight later.

DILEMMA.title: Negotiate or Fight
DILEMMA.description: Intelligent enemies ahead are willing to parley. They want something you have.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Negotiate: Give them gold/item. They let you pass and provide safe passage.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Refuse and fight: Keep your stuff but must fight them now.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Lie and betray: DC 20 Deception. They believe you, then you attack with surprise.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Betrayal works once. Word spreads. Future negotiations become impossible.

DILEMMA.title: Obstacle: Force or Finesse
DILEMMA.description: An obstacle blocks your path (collapsed rubble, locked door, etc). You can force through quickly or work around it carefully.
DILEMMA.choice_a: Force through: Use magic, strength, or explosives. Fast (5 minutes) but VERY loud. Alerts entire floor.
DILEMMA.choice_b: Work carefully: 30 minutes (add 3 dice). Quiet but exhausting. Everyone loses 1 action next combat.
DILEMMA.choice_c: Find another way: 20 minutes (add 2 dice) to explore and find an alternate route.
DILEMMA.gm_notes: Loud = all encounters alerted. Careful = fatigue penalty. Alternate = time cost. Adapt obstacle to match actual dungeon layout.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Patrol Approaching!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You hear heavy footsteps and voices. A patrol is coming this way. You have seconds to act!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: Choose NOW: Hide (DC 17 Stealth), Prepare ambush (ready actions), or Flee (move away quickly)
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Hide: They pass by. Ambush: Surprise round. Flee: Avoid encounter.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Hide: They spot you (they get surprise). Flee: They chase you (running combat).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Immediate decision. No time to discuss. Tests party coordination.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Floor Collapsing!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: The floor beneath you cracks and gives way! Everyone make a Reflex save!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Reflex save to grab edge. DC 19 Athletics to pull yourself up.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You catch yourself and climb up. No damage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: You fall 15 feet into the room below. 3d6 damage. Separated from party.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: If anyone falls: they're in different room. Party must reunite. Adds tension.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Alarm Bell Ringing!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A loud bell starts ringing throughout this floor. You triggered a magical alarm!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Arcana or Thievery to disable in 3 actions, or flee immediately
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Alarm stops. Only nearby enemies alerted.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Alarm continues. All enemies on this floor are alerted and searching for you.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: If alarm continues: all remaining encounters get surprise round against party. Major consequence.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Fire Spreading!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A torch fell and ignited oil on the floor. Fire is spreading rapidly toward you!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Acrobatics to jump through flames (2d6 fire damage on failure) or DC 18 Athletics to break through wall
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take fire damage and must try again next round. Smoke inhalation (DC 16 Fort or sickened 1).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Escalating danger. Each round fire spreads. Eventually blocks passage entirely.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Ambush from Above!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Creatures drop from the ceiling onto the party! They were waiting in ambush!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: Everyone makes DC 18 Perception check. Success = act in surprise round. Failure = flat-footed.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You noticed them falling. You can act in surprise round.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: You're caught off-guard. Enemies get surprise round against you.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Surprise round is critical. Rewards high Perception. Punishes low Perception.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Magical Backlash!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: The magical ward you're examining suddenly explodes with energy!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 19 Reflex save or take 3d6 force damage. DC 20 Arcana to counter the effect.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You dodge or counter the blast. No damage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take full damage and are pushed 10 feet back.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Punishes careless interaction with magic. Rewards Arcana knowledge.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Falling Debris!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: The ceiling cracks and chunks of stone rain down on the party!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Reflex save to dodge. Take 2d6 bludgeoning damage on failure.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take damage and must make DC 16 Fort save or be stunned 1.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Environmental hazard. Can happen anywhere. Keeps party alert.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Poison Gas Seeping!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Green mist pours from cracks in the walls. It smells toxic!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Nature to identify and find safe air, or DC 18 Fort save each round you stay
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You identify safe breathing technique or find clean air pocket.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take 1d6 poison damage and become sickened 1. Worsens each round.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Forces movement. Can't stay in this area. Escalating danger.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Flooding Chamber!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Water rushes in from broken pipes. The room is flooding rapidly!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Athletics to swim to exit before water fills room. DC 16 Perception to spot air pocket.
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You reach the exit or find air pocket to breathe.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: You're underwater. Hold breath or start drowning (DC 15 Fort each round).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Escalating danger. Eventually room is completely flooded. Must escape or drown.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Summoning Circle Activating!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A summoning circle on the floor glows brightly. Something is being summoned!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Arcana to disrupt ritual (3 actions) or prepare for combat
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: A creature appears! Roll initiative. It's hostile.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: If disrupted: avoid combat. If not: combat encounter with summoned creature.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Swarm Attack!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Thousands of insects/rats/bats suddenly swarm from the walls!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 17 Reflex to cover face, DC 18 Nature to repel them with fire/smoke
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Take 2d6 damage and become sickened 2 from bites and disease.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Sickened 2 = -2 to all checks. Very debilitating. Lasts until treated.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Sniper!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: An arrow whistles past your head! Someone is shooting from hiding!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 19 Perception to spot them, DC 18 Acrobatics to take cover
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You spot the sniper or reach cover. Can act normally.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Another arrow! Take 2d8 damage. Still don't know where they are.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Sniper has cover and concealment. Hard to fight back without spotting them.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Magical Explosion!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: A magical trap detonates! Fireball erupts around you!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 19 Reflex save or take 4d6 fire damage (half on success)
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You dive aside. Take half damage.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Full damage and catch fire (1d6 persistent fire damage).
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Persistent fire requires action to extinguish. Major resource drain.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Betrayal!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: An NPC you trusted suddenly attacks! They were a spy all along!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Perception to notice their intent, or they get surprise round
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You see it coming. Roll initiative normally.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: They attack with surprise! You're flat-footed.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Betrayal hurts. NPC knows party tactics and weaknesses.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Ceiling Collapse!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: The entire ceiling is coming down! Tons of stone falling!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 19 Athletics to sprint to safety, DC 20 Acrobatics to dodge falling debris
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Buried! Take 4d6 damage and are restrained. DC 18 Athletics to dig out.
ACTIVE_THREAT.time_cost: 1 round to escape, 3 rounds to dig out if buried
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Restrained = can't move. Very dangerous in combat. Allies must help dig out.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Reinforcements Arriving!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: You hear war horns! Enemy reinforcements are rushing to this location!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: Flee now (no time to loot) or barricade and prepare (DC 18 Crafting, 1 round)
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You escape or create defensible position (+2 AC from cover).
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Caught in the open when reinforcements arrive. Outnumbered 2-to-1.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Reinforcements are fresh and numerous. Very dangerous fight if caught.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Hostage Situation!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Enemies have grabbed a civilian/ally and hold a knife to their throat!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Diplomacy to negotiate, DC 22 Intimidation to make them back down, or DC 19 ranged attack to shoot knife
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Hostage is safe. Enemies surrender or flee.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: High stakes. Failure has permanent consequences. Tests player judgment.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Magical Darkness Spreading!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Unnatural darkness spreads from a source, consuming all light!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 20 Arcana to counter-spell, DC 18 Religion if unholy, or flee before engulfed
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: Darkness is stopped or you escape its area.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Engulfed in darkness. Blinded. All creatures concealed. Can't target spells.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Blinded = -4 to Perception, flat-footed, 50% miss chance. Extremely dangerous.

ACTIVE_THREAT.title: Stampede!
ACTIVE_THREAT.description: Panicked creatures are stampeding toward you! Dozens of them!
ACTIVE_THREAT.immediate_action: DC 18 Athletics to brace against wall, DC 19 Acrobatics to dodge, or DC 17 Nature to calm them
ACTIVE_THREAT.success: You avoid the stampede or calm the creatures.
ACTIVE_THREAT.failure: Trampled! Take 3d6 damage and knocked prone. Creatures keep running.
ACTIVE_THREAT.gm_notes: Prone in a stampede is very dangerous. Can be trampled multiple times.
